title: What is a Loan Against Mutual Funds (LAMF)?
content: A Loan Against Mutual Funds (LAMF) allows you to borrow money by pledging your mutual fund units as collateral. Your units remain invested and continue earning returns; only a temporary lien is created.

title: How does a Loan Against Mutual Funds work?
content: Your mutual fund units are lien-marked in favor of the lender. You receive a sanctioned credit limit and can withdraw funds as needed. Interest is charged only on the amount you utilize.

title: How much loan can I take against mutual funds?
content: Loan-to-Value (LTV) depends on scheme type. Equity mutual funds allow up to 45–50% LTV, while debt mutual funds allow up to 75–80%. Actual limits depend on the eligible scheme list and market volatility.

title: Do my mutual funds keep earning returns after pledging?
content: Yes. The mutual fund units remain invested and continue to earn gains, dividends, and NAV movements. Only redemption is restricted while the lien exists.

title: Can I continue SIPs on pledged mutual funds?
content: Yes. SIPs continue normally. However, newly added SIP units may require separate pledging if you want them included in the collateral pool.

title: Will pledging mutual funds trigger capital gains tax?
content: No. Pledging creates a lien, not a sale. Capital gains tax applies only when you redeem mutual fund units.

title: What is the typical loan tenure for LAMF?
content: The standard loan tenure is 36 months with flexible repayment options and foreclosure available at any time.

title: What are the benefits of LAMF compared to a personal loan?
content: LAMF offers lower interest rates, faster approval, minimal documentation, no income proof in many cases, overdraft-style usage, and allows you to retain market upside on investments.

title: What risks are involved in a Loan Against Mutual Funds?
content: The primary risk is market volatility. If NAV falls sharply, a margin call may be issued requiring partial repayment or additional collateral. Failure to comply can result in liquidation of pledged units.

title: Does checking my LAMF limit affect my credit score?
content: No. Checking your loan eligibility or limit does not affect your credit score. However, delayed payments or defaults will impact your score.

title: Can NRIs avail Loan Against Mutual Funds?
content: Yes. NRIs can avail LAMF if their mutual fund holdings are FEMA compliant and part of the lender’s approved scheme list.

title: Are jointly held mutual funds eligible for LAMF?
content: Yes. All unit holders must authorize the pledge. Some lenders may require additional co-borrower documentation.

title: What happens if I don’t repay my LAMF?
content: The lender may redeem your pledged mutual fund units to recover outstanding principal, interest, and applicable charges.

title: When is the lien removed from mutual funds?
content: The lien is removed immediately after full repayment. Lien removal usually completes within 48–72 hours.

title: Are there any restrictions on loan usage?
content: No. Loan proceeds can be used for business, personal, emergency, or discretionary purposes.

title: What documents are required for LAMF?
content: Generally required documents include PAN, Aadhaar, bank account details, and contact details linked to mutual fund folios. Most journeys are fully digital.

title: Is a demat account required for LAMF?
content: No. Statement of Account (SOA) mutual funds serviced by CAMS or KFin are supported. Demat holdings are also supported through depository pledge.

title: Are there any processing fees or hidden charges?
content: Charges vary by lender and may include processing fees, lien or pledge charges, bounce charges, and late payment interest.

title: How is DiscvrAI’s LAMF different from traditional loans?
content: DiscvrAI offers LAMF without income documentation, provides a credit line based on MF value, interest-only monthly payments, flexible withdrawals, and repayment within 36 months.

title: What is the minimum loan amount on DiscvrAI?
content: The minimum loan amount available on DiscvrAI is ₹25,000.

title: What is the maximum loan amount on DiscvrAI?
content: The maximum loan amount depends on the eligible mutual fund value and lender-defined LTV limits.

title: What will my monthly payment look like?
content: You pay only monthly interest on the utilized loan amount. For example, an outstanding of ₹1,00,000 at 10.4% p.a. results in approximately ₹866.67 monthly interest.

title: Can DiscvrAI LAMF be used as a credit line?
content: Yes. Once you repay the principal, your credit limit restores and you can withdraw funds again anytime.

title: How fast is loan approval and disbursal?
content: If eligible, approval, lien creation, and disbursal typically complete within 2 working hours.

title: Who is the lender for DiscvrAI LAMF?
content: Loans are offered by Bajaj Finance Limited through the Smallcase SDK integrated into DiscvrAI.

title: How is DiscvrAI’s credit limit calculated?
content: Equity mutual funds are considered up to 45% of market value, while debt mutual funds are considered up to 75% of market value.

title: Which mutual funds are eligible for LAMF?
content: Funds must be part of Bajaj Finance Limited’s approved list via Smallcase SDK. ELSS under lock-in, already pledged funds, or blacklisted schemes are not eligible.

title: Why is my eligible loan limit showing zero?
content: Possible reasons include holding only ELSS funds, ineligible schemes, already pledged units, low portfolio value, or incorrect contact details.

title: Does DiscvrAI share my mutual fund data externally?
content: No. Your data remains within the Smallcase SDK and lender integration ecosystem.

title: Why are my holdings re-imported during the journey?
content: Holdings are re-imported to recalculate actual loan eligibility before pledging.

title: Which email or phone number should I use to fetch holdings?
content: For CAMS funds, use the registered email ID. For KFin funds, use the registered mobile number.

title: Why is my credit limit different from earlier?
content: Credit limits may change due to NAV fluctuations, fund eligibility changes, lock-ins, blacklisting, or prior pledges.

title: Can I choose which mutual funds to pledge?
content: Yes. DiscvrAI allows you to select from all eligible mutual funds available for pledging.

title: Why are fewer units shown than my actual holding?
content: Units under lock-in such as ELSS cannot be pledged, so only free units are displayed.

title: Why do I need to link a bank account?
content: The bank account is required for loan disbursal, monthly interest auto-debits, repayments, and withdrawals.

title: Why is an e-mandate required?
content: An e-mandate is required to auto-debit monthly interest payments and avoid late payment penalties.

title: What should I do if I get an invalid IFSC error?
content: Verify the IFSC code from your bank passbook, statement, or UPI app. If the issue persists, contact support.

title: Why is the white popup stuck during mandate setup?
content: This is usually due to blocked third-party cookies. Enable them in your browser settings and retry.

title: What happens if I set up a mandate but don’t want the loan?
content: You can cancel the e-mandate from your bank’s net banking portal. The loan will not proceed without pledging.

title: What happens when I pledge my mutual funds?
content: The mutual fund units are lien-marked in favor of the lender, disabling redemption until loan closure.

title: Can I invest more or exit pledged mutual funds?
content: You cannot redeem pledged units, but you can continue investing in the same folio.

title: When are mutual funds unpledged?
content: Mutual funds are unpledged after full repayment and loan closure.

title: Is partial unpledging allowed?
content: No. Partial unpledging is not supported. Full repayment is required for unpledging.

title: Are there tax implications for pledging mutual funds?
content: There is no tax impact unless the mutual fund units are sold.

title: What if I pledged funds but don’t want the loan anymore?
content: If the agreement is not e-signed, DiscvrAI support can unpledge the funds. A lien removal charge of approximately ₹500 may apply.

title: Why is the screen stuck on generating agreement?
content: This may occur due to PDF generation latency. Contact support for assistance.

title: How do I sign the loan agreement?
content: Scroll through the agreement, verify via OTP, and complete digital signing.

title: How long does disbursal take after signing?
content: Disbursal usually happens within 2 working hours after successful pledge and e-sign.

title: What happens after loan application submission?
content: The lender reviews the application, approves it, and disburses funds to your linked bank account.

title: What should I do if disbursal is delayed?
content: Contact DiscvrAI support. Lender intervention may be required in stuck cases.

title: Where can I manage my loan?
content: You can manage your loan inside the DiscvrAI Loan Dashboard powered by Smallcase SDK.

title: How are monthly dues deducted?
content: Monthly interest dues are auto-debited from your linked bank account.

title: How can I repay the loan fully or partially?
content: Go to the Loan Dashboard, select Repay Cash, and enter the repayment amount.

title: How does withdrawal work after repayment?
content: After repaying principal, your credit limit restores and you can withdraw funds from ₹1,000 up to the available limit.

title: What happens if I miss a monthly interest payment?
content: A bounce charge of ₹1,200 applies along with late interest of approximately 1.5%–2% per month on the overdue amount.

title: What happens if mutual fund values drop significantly?
content: If outstanding exceeds allowed LTV, a margin call is issued. You must repay the difference within 7 days or units may be liquidated.

title: When can pledged mutual funds be liquidated?
content: Liquidation may occur if margin calls are unmet, dues remain unpaid at tenure end, or in cases of severe delinquency.

title: How do I close my LAMF loan?
content: Go to the Loan Dashboard, request closure, repay all dues, and the lien will be removed.

title: Why is my mandate not setting up?
content: Mandate failures usually occur due to blocked third-party cookies. Enable cookies and retry.

title: Why are mutual fund values mismatched?
content: NAV updates occur daily on market days, and real-time refresh may cause temporary variations.

title: Why didn’t my holdings fetch correctly?
content: This usually happens due to incorrect email/mobile input or funds serviced by a different RTA.

title: How can I contact LAMF support?
content: You can call or WhatsApp the DiscvrAI LAMF support team at +91 88265 45484 for assistance with loan-related queries.
